title: Effects of cash deposit, addtl 10 percent reserves

content.description:
In answering the question, you should emphasize the line of reasoning that generated your results; it is not enough to list the results of your analysis. Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes.

In banking systems with limited reserves, banks play an important role in determining changes in the money supply.

Assume that a bank receives a cash deposit of $9,000 from a customer. What is the immediate impact of this transaction on the money supply? Explain.

Suppose that the reserve requirement is 10 percent and banks voluntarily keep an additional 10 percent in reserves. Calculate each of the following. Show your work.

The maximum amount by which this bank will increase its loans from the transaction in part (a)

The maximum increase in the money supply that will be generated from the transaction in part (a)

Assume that the government increases spending by $9,000, which is financed by a sale of bonds to the central bank.

Indicate what will happen to the money supply.

Explain what will happen to the money demand.
content.question: Respond to all parts of the question.
